s1: Offensive Cyber Security operations introduces and exercises a complete range of reverse engineering techniques and attack patterns. Students will also learn and exercise analysis of systems based on minimal information.
s2: In this course students will explore these concepts through practical implementation in a modern computer graphics software context.

s1: This is a complete course in cyber attacks which enables students on successful completion to identify and test systems for vulnerabilities without full knowledge or direct access.
s2: In this course students will explore these concepts through practical implementation in a modern computer graphics software context.

s1: Demonstrate a thorough understanding of the fundamental principles underlying the identification and testing for vulnerabilities with limited information.
s2: In this course students will explore these concepts through practical implementation in a modern computer graphics software context.

s1: Analyze a system across all abstraction levels, from basic hardware to complex cloud architectures.
s2: These key concepts in computer graphics programming will be covered from their mathematical foundations through to their application in domains such as data visualisation, virtual reality, computer games and film animation/VFX.

s1: Run cyber attacks, tests and probes in a practical context.
s2: In this course students will explore these concepts through practical implementation in a modern computer graphics software context.

s1: Expand conventional attack patterns to work in new system and network architectures.
s2: In this course students will explore these concepts through practical implementation in a modern computer graphics software context.

s1: Communicate a cyber security vulnerability and potential paths of attack to a heterogenous team of professionals.
s2: In this course students will explore these concepts through practical implementation in a modern computer graphics software context.
